message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the production of sound. Option (A) is the correct answer because tapping a chopstick on a pillow would create noise. When the chopstick hits the pillow, it causes vibrations that are transmitted as sound waves. Option (B) is incorrect because standing still does not create noise. Option (C) is incorrect because holding in a fart does not produce audible noise. Option (D) is also incorrect because remaining silent means not producing any sound.

This question requires a basic understanding of sound production and how noise is created. Option (A) is the correct answer because tapping a chopstick on a pillow would produce a sound, creating noise. Option (B) is incorrect because standing still does not produce noise. Option (C) is unrelated to noise creation and refers to holding in gas. Option (D) is incorrect because remaining silent does not produce noise.
